With the band They Might Be Giants.

Well, this has a little story behind it.

We used to cover a science song - in fact, we still do - called ""Why Does The Sun Shine,"" which is from a bunch of science - the question of science songs that came out when we were kids with Tom Glazer - and I don't know if you're familiar with this record.

But the song was called ""Why Does the Sun Shine"" and in parenthesis, ""The Sun Is a Mass of Incandescent Gas."" And I - what we found out was that it - subsequently, I figured out that the sun is not actually made of gas after the song become popular among kids and…
I got better - I better relearn something else.
We're here to tell you that…
…that there are four states of matter.
And the sun is actually super excited gas, which is called plasma.
The electrons have stripped off - been stripped off.
